question: Mr. Leo has 12 apples. If he wants to divide them into 3 baskets, how many apples will go in each basket?
Mr. Leo has 10 oranges. If he shares them with 2 children, how many oranges does each child get?
Mr. Leo bakes 15 cookies. If he puts them into 5 boxes, how many cookies are in each box?
Mr. Leo has 20 pieces of candy. If he gives them to 4 children, how many pieces does each child receive?
Mr. Leo has 36 snack packs. If he divides them into groups of 6, how many groups can he make?
There are 24 juice boxes. If 6 students want to share them equally, how many juice boxes does each student get?
A group of 32 toy figures is divided among 8 students. How many toy figures does each student receive?
There are 25 basketballs. If 5 students want to share them equally, how many basketballs does each student receive?
There are 49 pencils that need to be divided among 7 students. How many pencils does each student receive?
Mr. Leo has 45 granola bars. If he wants to pack them into bags of 9, how many bags can he fill?
